GIS.csv

Class CSVfile

  • java.lang.Object
    • GIS.csv.CSVfile

  • public class CSVfile
extends java.lang.Object
    An Object CSVfile can be instanced by handing over the needed connection parameters (path, delimiter). With a Scanner the CSV-file can be acessed. A CSV-file needs to have these three columns: ID, type, geometry.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.String delimiter
      The delimeter seperating the columns (not allowed to be ",")
      java.lang.String path
      The path to the CSV file to import/store

    • Method Detail

      • openCSV

        public boolean openCSV()

      • insertPoint

        public boolean insertPoint(GISPoint point)
        get attribute id and type from the Point Object. Call the writeGeometryAsText method to get the geometry in something that you could call wellknowntext. Insert id, type and geometry as a new line in the CSV. return true when processed sucessfull

      • insertPolyline

        public boolean insertPolyline(GISPolyline polyline)
        get attribute id and type from the Polyline Object. Call the writeGeometryAsText method to get the geometry in something that you could call wellknowntext. Insert id, type and geometry as a new line in the CSV. return true when processed sucessfull

      • insertPolygon

        public boolean insertPolygon(GISPolygon polygon)
        get attribute id and type from the Polygon Object. Call the writeGeometryAsText method to get the geometry in something that you could call wellknowntext. Insert id, type and geometry as a new line in the CSV. return true when processed sucessfull

      • loadGeometries

        public java.util.ArrayList loadGeometries(java.lang.String type)
        Input Parameter type needs to be one of this three strings: "Point" "Polyline" "Polygon" load all rows stored in the DB where type="polyline". For each row 1. create a Polyline object using the column values of ID and type. 2. Assign the coordinates using the method geometryAsTextToPolyline, which will use as input parameter the string where the geometry as wellknowntext is saved. Store the Polylines in an Array List of the type Polyline. return the Array List.

      • deleteGeometry

        public boolean deleteGeometry(int id)
